CurrentUserREST Resource

Endpoints for getting and setting information about the current user. Note that these methods work only with the currently authenticated user, even though they accept a user_id path parameter.

PUT /users/{user_id}/password

Changes the user's password.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
user_id path The user ID of the user. The current user's ID can be retrieved using the user_id property of the object returned by the initial user authentication (see SessionREST POST /session). int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json ChangePasswordInfoDTO (JSON) The information about the old and new password.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) The status of the operation.

GET /users/{user_id}

Retrieves information about the currently authenticated user.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
user_id path The user ID of the user. The current user's ID can be retrieved using the user_id property of the object returned by the initial user authentication (see SessionREST POST /session). int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json JustUserDTO (JSON) Information about the currently authenticated user.

PUT /users/{user_id}

Saves the user-editable fields for the user (e.g. name, phone number, etc.).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
user_id path The user ID of the user. The current user's ID can be retrieved using the user_id property of the object returned by the initial user authentication (see SessionREST POST /session). int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json JustUserDTO (JSON) The information about the user that is to be saved.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) Status of the operation.
